Never mind!  I hope you all will forgive my useful
enthusiasm (2nd childhood I suppose) but I have
discovered a bug in my code that allowed the ANNs to
discover how to cheat.  This was not obvious because
it only happened after two or more cards had already
been removed.  At that point if the computer picked
the 0 element of the array, it would get a match,
albeit a false one.  The ANNs slowly learned to pick 0
when there were empty spaces on the board.

I have fixed it, and just started them evolving from
scratch again just a few minutes ago.  So far they are
much weaker than my reference player that picks
blindly at random.  I will keep you posted of course.


=====
Mitchell Timin
http://annevolve.sourceforge.net
